title: Variables & Data Types
description: Test your knowledge of JavaScript variables and data types in this quick quiz.

questions.question: Which keyword creates a block-scoped variable in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The 'let' keyword creates block-scoped variables, while 'var' is function-scoped. 'const' creates block-scoped constants.

questions.question: What is the result of typeof null in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: typeof null returns 'object' due to a legacy bug in JavaScript that has been kept for backward compatibility.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a primitive data type in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Arrays are objects in JavaScript, not primitive types. The primitive types are: string, number, boolean, null, undefined, symbol, and bigint.
